title: Topic 001 Question 165
body: Which is the best way to specify a tag of v1.0.0 when referencing a module stored in Git (for example git::https://example.com/vpc.git)?
options: Append ?ref=v1. 0. 0 argument to the source path
Add version = "1.0.0" parameter to module block
Nothing ג€" modules stored on GitHub always default to version 1.0.0
Modules stored on GitHub do not support versioning
